title: US citizen wants to marry his flight attendant girlfriend during her short stop here.
question: She will return to her country after. Will there be any complication once i petition her?
question_tags: Immigration,US visas,Immigrant status,Bankruptcy,Debt,Debt relief,Bankruptcy and debt
answers:
There should not be an issue with a U.S. citizen getting married to his flight attendant girlfriend during her short stop in the United States, especiallly since she intends to return to her home country following the marriage. A problem would arise if the girlfriend/spouse sought to adjust her status in the United States to permanent resident.

Once the girlfriend/spouse returns to her home country, the U.S. citizen can file a petition sponsoring her for permanent resident ("green card"/immigrant) status.

Usually flight attendants enter on a C visa (crew visa). Such visas cannot be changed and does not allow change of status. If you get married to her you will need to file a K visa or a straight greencard while she is abroad. If you are not familiar with the paperwork, please retain a lawyer to help.
